Speaker: crais
Dialogue: That was the scene in California's Mojave Desert three years ago today -- the historic first view of the Newcomer ship upon its dramatic arrival.  As with the assassination of John Kennedy, who among us does not remember exactly where he was that October nineteenth morning, when news first broke: that people have landed... from another star.

Speaker: fedorchuk
Dialogue: I remember where I was -- pissing off my balcony at the neighbor's dog!

Speaker: alterez
Dialogue: Get to the goddamn ball scores!

Speaker: crais
Dialogue: These "Newcomers," we soon learned, were a genetically-engineered race, adapted for hard labor in almost any environmental condition.  In effect, their ship was a slave ship... washed ashore on Earth with no way to get back to where they came from...

Speaker: fresno housewife
Dialogue: When the Newcomers were first let out of the ship, they were quarantined in a camp not ten miles from the town here.  You can imagine how the people around here felt about that.  But once they were releases from the camp and we got a chance to know them, we saw what nice, quiet people they really are...

Speaker: fedorchuk
Dialogue: Hey, Henry, how you doin' tonight? Workin' hard?

Speaker: fedorchuk
Dialogue: You got your green card, buddy?  You didn't leave home without it?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Jeez... they call that gang-bang a game...?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Take a hike.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Why's it have to be sour milk that these guys get wasted on?  What the hell's wrong with Jack Daniels, or Thunderbird for chrissakes?  Slagtown.  Shit...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Hope their plumbing's the same.

Speaker: tuggle
Dialogue: It is.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: How can I go?

Speaker: tuggle
Dialogue: Put on your wash-and-wear suit and your clip-on tie, have your landlady tie your shoes for you, and show up at the church.  Simple.  Me and Carol are going.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: tuggle
Dialogue: Hey, look -- we've known Kristin since... since she was conceived in that cabin up in Big Bear. Remember?  You and Edie banged the wall so hard, me and Carol were picking plaster out of our hair for a week...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Goddammit, Tug -- I want to see Kristin get married, okay?  But--

Speaker: tuggle
Dialogue: But you're bummed because your ex and her new husband are paying for the whole thing.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Shit, if Kristin had to get married where I could afford it, we'd be holding the reception at Buddy's Burgers.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Uh-oh... Check it out.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Does that look at all suspicious to you?

Speaker: tuggle
Dialogue: Whatever gave you that idea?

Speaker: tuggle
Dialogue: This is one-Henry-seven, we've got a possible two-eleven in progress at Porter's Mini-Mart, corner of Court and Alvarado.  Requesting backup.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Let's do it, partner.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: You got your vest?

Speaker: tuggle
Dialogue: Of course.  Right in the trunk of the car.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Yeah, that's comforting.  Mine, too.

Speaker: tuggle
Dialogue: Watch the driver.  I'm going for a better angle on the door.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: I got him.  Don't get pinned.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Aw, shit.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Get outta there!

Speaker: tuggle
Dialogue: I can't!  Do you mind!

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: I'll cover you!  Get outta there!!

Speaker: old man
Dialogue: Can I get out now?

Speaker: tuggle
Dialogue: Move it!

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Aw shit, Tug, Jesus!  Goddamn it!

Speaker: human cop
Dialogue: Whoa, whoa... hold it.  Take it easy.  You okay?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: I am all right.

Speaker: human cop
Dialogue: I better call in.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Your hand will require attention.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Get the hell away from me!  I don't need your goddamn help.

Speaker: natuzzi
Dialogue: Looks like a standard combat pump- action.

Speaker: minkler
Dialogue: It is.

Speaker: natuzzi
Dialogue: So what punched holes clear through that car out there?

Speaker: minkler
Dialogue: BRI Sabot slugs.  These puppies are nasty.  Two plastic sabots fall away in flight leaving a fifty-caliber slug going two thousand feet per second.  Tug might as well've been hiding behind a rosebush.

Speaker: natuzzi
Dialogue: Pretty heavy artillery for knocking over a liquor store.

Speaker: minkler
Dialogue: Yeah?  So why the extra fire power?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Perhaps because even the larger caliber handguns aren't always effective against my people.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: You saying there's some connection to this other homicide?

Speaker: female cop
Dialogue: Hey, give me a hand with this woman, will ya Jetson?  We've got to get her to Division for her statement and she won't budge.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Excuse me.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: So, you think there's a connection, or what?  Hey!

Speaker: kristin's voice
Dialogue: Danny thought Tug was the greatest -- but, then, who doesn't?  Anyway, love you, talk to you soon.  'Bye.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: So what've you got on Tuggle's killers?

Speaker: fedorchuk
Dialogue: Jesus, Sykes -- it's been less than ten hours.  Me and Alterez are on it, okay?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: You don't have squat.

Speaker: fedorchuk
Dialogue: You ever try to make a case in Slagtown?  The list of Newcomer informants is about as long as the list of Mexican war heroes...

Speaker: alterez
Dialogue: Up yours.

Speaker: fedorchuk
Dialogue: ... Nobody talks to nobody down there.  Half of them don't speak English and the other half only when it suits them.  It's gonna take some time.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Yeah, I know it's gonna take time. Like until the Ice Capades opens in Hell, with you two on it.

Speaker: warner
Dialogue: Nobody wanders off!  I got an announcement.  Get your asses back in here.

Speaker: warner
Dialogue: I'll make this short.  This is a directive from Chief Evaner, who is acting on orders from the Mayor, who is under mandate from the Federal Bureau of Newcomer Relations.  As of nine o'clock this morning, one Newcomer uniform officer has been promoted to the rank of Detective, third grade.

Speaker: warner
Dialogue: And we've got him, gentleman.  Volunteers for duty with the new detective should see me in my office... otherwise I will choose a volunteer myself.  That is all.

Speaker: fedorchuk
Dialogue: Unbelievable bullshit.

Speaker: alterez
Dialogue: How long has this Slag been on the force?  A year, max -- right?

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: I don't know about the rest of you, but I sure as hell ain't gonna sit still for this.  I'm calling the union, pronto.

Speaker: fedorchuk
Dialogue: Where the hell is he going?

Speaker: warner
Dialogue: Yeah, Sykes?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Captain.  I'd like to volunteer for duty with the new detective.

Speaker: warner
Dialogue: ... All right.  Detective Sergeant Sykes, this is Detective... Jetson.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: We have met.

Speaker: goldrup
Dialogue: Victor Goldrup, Mayor's office. Congratulations, gentlemen.

Speaker: warner
Dialogue: You are to have nothing to do with the investigation into Bill Tuggle's death.  You know that.  Leave that for Fedorchuk.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Departmental policy.

Speaker: warner
Dialogue: You?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: warner
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: There's another case I'd like to take.  A homicide -- a Newcomer named Hubley.

Speaker: warner
Dialogue: Granger and Pitts are already on it.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Granger and Pitts have one hell of a caseload... and I would have thought with Jetson here being the first Newcomer plainclothes, and Hubley's body being found over in the Newcomer community...

Speaker: warner
Dialogue: Don't tell me what to think.

Speaker: goldrup
Dialogue: He's got a point.  That's the sort of thing we should be doing with this early advancement program...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: ... and we work my hours.  I'll do the driving, you do the paperwork. You gotta learn it so you might as well do it all.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Sergeant... I'd like to thank you for what you're doing.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: What's that?  Look, Jetson.  Get this straight in your head.  We're not pals, we're not married, and we ain't gonna take long moonlight walks together... We're just partners.  And don't call me Sergeant.  Call me Sykes... or Matt if you have to.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: I am George.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Wait a minute.  George?  George Jetson?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Man, somebody really hung one on you!  I've heard some good ones for you guys... Humphrey Bogart, Harley Davidson.  I guess the people at immigration got a little punchy after a while, coming up with names for a quarter of a million of you. You weren't at the back of the line, were you, George?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: My true name is Ss'tangya T'ssorentsa'.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Gesundheit.  You don't mind if I stick to George, do you?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Anyway, what's it matter to you if we think it's funny, right?  Whatta you care?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: That is exactly so.  It is like your name... Sykes.  I'm sure it doesn't bother you at all that it sounds like "ss'ai k'ss", two words in my language which mean "excrement" and "cranium".

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: "Shit... head".

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Let's talk Hubley.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: His body was discovered three days ago, in an alley off of Central Avenue, near downtown.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: With two BRI Sabot slugs in the chest.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Through the chest.  Rupturing both the primary and secondary hearts.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Nice signal, dickwad!

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: He was employed at the Northwest Petroleum Refinery in Torrance.  He was manager of the Methane Facility. He was also a principle partner in a real estate venture to develop low- cost housing for Newcomers.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Terrific.  A real pillar of the community.  Was Hubley missing anything when they found him?  Was he ripped off?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: There was no wallet... but he was still wearing a watch and two rings.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: The guys at the mini-mart last night made a half-assed stab at the money in the till -- but I don't think that's what they were there for.  I think we got us a couple'a executions on our hands, George...

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: The murder at the mini-mart is not our case.  The Captain said--

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Look, you want to fit in here, right?  You want to learn how to get along?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Well, there's a thing about partners, about being somebody's partner.  You do for each other. And other people's rules don't mean shit.  It's the rules set up between the two of you, that's all that counts.  Understand?  Okay.  Well, my friend and partner was shot last night and I'm after the shitbag that did it.  As my partner, I'm asking you to respect me and help me find him.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: And as my partner, I ask you to respect me and my desire not to break with procedure.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: What is wrong?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Nothing's wrong.  I just want to get something straight.  You agree that there's a good chance these two shootings are somehow related, right?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Well... yes, quite possibly.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Possibly.  Good.  Well, would you be willing to accept the theory, George, that... possibly... by examining the evidence from one case we might shed some small ray of light on the other?  Does that sound unreasonable to you?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Yes... no, it is not unreasonable. Although I--

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Great.  Well, I'm sure glad that's settled, aren't you?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: I think we're really starting to click now, George -- hmmm?

Speaker: winter
Dialogue: You know I've been over all this with Fedorchuk and Alterez this morning...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Come on.  You got nothin' better to do, cushy county job like yours.

Speaker: winter
Dialogue: Yeah, right.  Don't push your luck. Anyway, according to the sheet, the guy you nailed outside by the car--

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: The human?

Speaker: winter
Dialogue: Yeah... he was one Martin Helder. White male, twenty-seven.  Let's see... wrap sheet shows one armed robbery conviction, a couple for sale of a controlled substance. Oh yeah, and he was wired on coke when you stopped his clock.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Have you identified this one?

Speaker: winter
Dialogue: So far he's a John Doe.  Or a Sam Slag, if you like.

Speaker: winter
Dialogue: No I.D. on him and -- well, you know, no fingerprints -- so it could be tough.  Your buddies this morning went through the mug book but couldn't make a facial match.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Fedorchuk couldn't find his ass with his hands in his back pockets.

Speaker: winter
Dialogue: You took this gut out, too, didn't you?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: winter
Dialogue: Lucky for you, you got him in both of his... well, what we loosely refer to as... hearts.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Lucky nothing.  I had to empty my damn gun into him.

Speaker: winter
Dialogue: That's the way these people are. You don't hit both pumps you just piss them off.

Speaker: winter
Dialogue: Oh, here's an extra headshot if you need one.  We're just about to start cutting in.  You're welcome to stick around if you want.  It's really fascinating stuff.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Yeah, I'll bet.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: What's this?  What's going on?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Nothing?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Shouldn't we examine their personal effects?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: What is this?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: You need this for anything?

Speaker: ortiz
Dialogue: Nope, got my own.  Anything you guys don't use gets stuffed away in storage.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Get the picture?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: And that fits?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Well... Yeah, it's rubber.  It stretches.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: And still it fits?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: What is this stuff?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: It is a resin.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Newcomers working near methane gasses at oil refineries must paint it on their boots to protect against sparks.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: How the hell do you know that?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: A large number of my people were hired by refineries because the methane fumes are not harmful to us. My spouse's brother is one.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: So the Slag they're cutting into upstairs worked at a refinery just like Hubley worked at a refinery.  Okay, next step -- I gotta go talk to the wife of the Slag store owner blown away last night.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: I believe I should interview the widow alone.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Why the hell--?!  Great, fine.  You talk to the wife.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Well, one of the men didn't like him so much...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: We think he could'a been involved, yeah.  You know him?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Who else can I ask around here?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: I think you're gonna find he's taken the rest of his life off.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: That where Anderson worked?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Jesus.  Welcome back Ozzie and Harriet...

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Mrs. Porter is not taking her husband's death well.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Did you learn anything?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: A week ago two men came to see her husband.  After they left, he was very frightened.  She identified one of the men from a photo I showed her.  It was Hubley.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Aw-right.  What about the other guy?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: She didn't know him.  But she said her son might.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Did you talk to him?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: He has not been home since that day. But she told me where to find him.

Speaker: mayor
Dialogue: ... Our guest speaker tonight has done so much in his community and for his community in such a short period of time.  And I must say, as the founder of the first Newcomer owned and operated corporation in Southern California, he certainly has come quite far in the last few years.  Granted, not as far as he came in the years before reaching Los Angeles.

Speaker: mayor
Dialogue: As Mayor of this city, it gives me great pleasure to introduce someone who has so readily made our city his home... and all of us who live here, his friends.  Ladies and gentlemen, William Harcourt.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: Thank you all for that very warm reception.  I'm particularly grateful because I actually had the gall to write that in my notes: "Thank you all for that very warm reception".  Imagine how embarrassed I would've been if it hadn't have been such a warm reception.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: William Harcourt?

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: I'm Sergeant Sykes, and this is Detective Jetson, Los Angeles Police Department.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: Sergeant... Detective.  I wasn't aware there were any Newcomers at the rank of Detective yet.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: I am the first.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: Congratulations.  This is my administrative assistant, Rudyard Kipling.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Listen, we just need a minute of your time...

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: We'd like to ask you about a business associate of your, Warren Hubley.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: Yes, I heard about poor Warren. Tragic.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: You were partners with him on some Slag -- uh, Newcomer real estate thing.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: That's right.  He and I, along with seven or eight others.  Listen, gentlemen, I will be happy to assist you in any way I can -- unfortunately, at the moment, I'm overdue at another function.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: Mr. Mayor...

Speaker: mayor
Dialogue: William, I was wondering if you wouldn't rather ride with Luisa and me.  Two limousines trying to make it across town in all this traffic, we're bound to be later than we already are.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: Excellent idea.  Ray, I wonder if you know two of your police officers... Detective Jetson and Sykes.

Speaker: mayor
Dialogue: We really should be going.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: Congratulations again on your promotion, Detective.  Remember... you're out there setting an example in our community.  I'll be keeping an eye on you.

Speaker: kipling
Dialogue: That cop, the human, he was the one who killed Anderson and the driver.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: This is becoming a serious breach of security.

Speaker: kipling
Dialogue: He didn't recognize me.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: It is his new partner that I'm worried about.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Go on ahead.  I'll be right in.  What'd you dig up for me?

Speaker: maffet
Dialogue: You said you wanted the biggest thing I could find... Well, this is it.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: maffet
Dialogue: Casull .454 Magnum.  You're talking twice the impact energy of .44 Magnum hot loads.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Only holds five.

Speaker: maffet
Dialogue: Yeah, the shells are too big for six in an cylinder.  Hell, Matt, you don't need but one.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: No... two.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Well, let's see what you got, Cochise.  Gimme six, rapid fire.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: How long you been shooting?  That's pitiful.  Whattya gonna do if somebody draws down on you, wave your scores on the written exam at 'em?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Why did you do it?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Why'd I do what?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Agree to work with me?  You don't like me... you don't like any of us. You have nothing but contempt for us.  And yet you become an outcast from your club of detectives by making me your partner...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: My partner is dead!  Because one of you bastards killed him -- then disappeared into a rathole down in Slagtown, where he's home and dry, 'cause nobody sees nothing, nobody says nothing...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: But he didn't figure on you, George. You're going to get me through that wall of silence.  You're going to make them talk to me.  You're going to help me find that Slag son-of-a- bitch.  Comprendo?  And if Fedorchuk and the boys in the bullpen don't like it, screw them... and if the Captain doesn't like it, screw him... and if all the Slags down in Slagtown don't like it... well screw them too!

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Okay, just stay back and do what I do.  Watch and learn, watch and learn...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: I can't see dick in here.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Which one'a you Slags is Porter?

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Who wants to know?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Who said that?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: At the end of the bar.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: My name is Sykes.  I'm--

Speaker: alien voice
Dialogue: Ss'ai k'ss?

Speaker: offender
Dialogue: Careful, ss'loka', you might hurt yourself.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: You Porter?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: No, Matthew.  I believe this is the one you want.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Your name wouldn't happen to be Porter, would it?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Uh, Matthew...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Back off, George.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: But I-- .

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: I'll handle it.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Is your name Porter?

Speaker: porter
Dialogue: Ss'kya'ta'.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Screw you.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Screw me?  That can't be right.

Speaker: porter
Dialogue: Ss'kya ta' ss'loka'.  Ss'trokya' ss'lato na'!

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: You don't want to know.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Tell me.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Your mother mates out of season.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: That's very colorful.  But see -- now I've got a problem.  I don't seem to be getting much cooperation from you, Porter.  So I guess we're gonna have to take this little session down to my office, ya know?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Matthew, you don't have to-- .

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Stay back!  I'm okay.

Speaker: porter
Dialogue: Don't they teach you anything about us in cop school, little ss'loka'?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Enough.

Speaker: porter
Dialogue: It fits you.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: You know that guy?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: From quarantine, when my people first arrived here.  He and I were housed together.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: How could a straight-arrow like you ever pick a roommate like him?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: In the camps, we were lodged four to a room.  The selection process was entirely random.  We did not get to stay with our friends... or families...

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: You don't know what your father and these two men were arguing about?

Speaker: porter
Dialogue: I told you -- I was in the back of the store.  I just heard voices, muffled like.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: One of the two men was Hubley, right?  What about the other one? Did you know him?

Speaker: porter
Dialogue: Yeah... I seen him around.  High- roller dude named Strader.  Joshua Strader.  Runs a club on the west side.  Encounters.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Yeah, I heard of it.

Speaker: porter
Dialogue: That's all I know.  You want anything more, you ask somebody else.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: I am sorry about your father.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: If I may make a suggestion... We have different weak spots than you do.  Next time, a blow to the nerve plexus under the arm, here, will produce the effect I think you were looking for.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Yeah, sure.  I knew that...

Speaker: kid
Dialogue: Six forty-two.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: I don't think I could ever learn to read that shit.  How long did it take you to learn English?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Three months.  We learn quickly.  We adapt.  It is our strength... what we were bred for, to adapt to hostile environments.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: My neighbor's kid has a Newcomer girl in his class.  She's six years old and in seventh grade already...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Oh, God.  I think I got yours here...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Which one is that?  Raw what?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: This is mole.  It's good.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: I'll bet.  Would it really put you out if they tossed that on the grill for a minute or two?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Our bodies do not assimilate the nutrients if the food has been cooked.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Oh, that's real attractive.  You got fur in your teeth, George.  Come on, man, we're gonna be talking to people... jeez.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: So what was that other word for Human... Slow ka?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Ss'loka'.  It means literally "small but intelligent creature".  It loses much in the translation.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: And what was that one about my mother?  That was a good one.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Ss'trokya ss'lato 'na'.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Yeah, that's it.  Say it slow.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: You are Cassandra?

Speaker: cassandra
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: We are with the Police Department. This is Sergeant Sykes, and I am--

Speaker: cassandra
Dialogue: Ss'ai k'ss?  Perfect.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: We're looking for your boss -- Strader.

Speaker: cassandra
Dialogue: He's not here.  Why ask me?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: The young woman at the front said you might know where he is.

Speaker: cassandra
Dialogue: She did, did she?  Well, she was wrong.  Excuse me, I have to change.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: No problem.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Look, we're not here doing an interview for the school paper. This is a homicide investigation... and if you don't stop jerkin' us around, I'm ready to start playin' hardball.

Speaker: cassandra
Dialogue: Oooh.  Hardball.  That sounds interesting.  Are you going to strike me?  You could tie me up and then do whatever you want with me... I've got my own ropes.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Does that cost extra or you throw them in?

Speaker: cassandra
Dialogue: You've got me all wrong.  I don't charge money for something that I myself find pleasurable...

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: I am going out to the car.  I will meet you there.

Speaker: cassandra
Dialogue: Look, I don't know where Mr. Strader might be.  He comes and he goes.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: The girl out front mentioned Strader's assistant, somebody named Watson.  Maybe he knows.

Speaker: cassandra
Dialogue: Todd?  Todd doesn't know either.

Speaker: cassandra
Dialogue: I know... Why don't you hang around for a while, let me entertain you? It's Matt, right?  Now tell me the truth, have you ever... made it... with one of us?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Not unless I got real drunk and nobody told me about it later.

Speaker: cassandra
Dialogue: A virgin.  I find that very arousing...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: There's lots of things I haven't done, but his ain't high on the list.  Don't take it personally.

Speaker: cassandra
Dialogue: I think you're just a little scared now, about what you might find once the lights go out.  A little scared... and a lot curious.  Maybe more than you want to admit.  But doesn't that turn you on, that curiosity and fear, swirling together?  Think of it as broadening your horizons.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: I like my horizons narrow.

Speaker: cassandra
Dialogue: Your voice is saying no, but your body is saying yes.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: My voice, body, and everything else is saying I'll be back in two hours for Strader, and he better damn well be here.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Freeze!  Now!

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Fire escape!  End of the hall!

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: How'd you like that, huh?  Whammo! Both barrels.  Dropped him like a bag of cement.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Who is he?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Todd Watson.  The assistant manager.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: I don't believe this.  Look at my suit.  Look at what you made me do to my car.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Your girlfriend put up a better fight than you did, pal.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: We are looking for your employer, Joshua Strader.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: He's out of town.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Why did you run?

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Because you two were chasing me.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: We were chasing you because you ran, you dumb son-of-a-bitch.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: When will Strader return?

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Who knows.  He's the boss -- he doesn't have to check in with me.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Watson... this is my partner here's first coupla days, and he wants to make a good impression.  Me, though, the way I feel -- this could be my last day, know what I mean?  And I'm ready to rain on you like a cow pissin' on a flat rock.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Look -- Mr. Strader hasn't been around for a coupla days.  He didn't tell me where he was going or when he'd be back.  I swear it.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: What do you think?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: I believe he is probably lying.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Through his ass.  Next time you see him, tell him to call me... unless you want us to keep coming back on you like a bad case of herpes.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: George, you can handle the women from now on, you mind?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Okay, scrape him up.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: Any progress?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: My arm's gettin' tired and so far, zip.

Speaker: kipling
Dialogue: He is ss'verdlatya ss'alo to Strader.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: What's that mean?

Speaker: kipling
Dialogue: Duty-bonded.  His allegiance to Strader is above pain or life.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: You tellin' me this guy would die before he'd screw his boss and work for us?  Nobody's that dumb.

Speaker: kipling
Dialogue: It is something you couldn't comprehend, Quint.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: I understand you have been resisting my offer Mr. Watson.  Your sense of duty to Mr. Strader is noble, but -- no longer an issue, I'm afraid...

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: I will not make this offer again.  I want you to work for me, to manage the nightclub as Strader's successor. If you do, you will know a wealth and comfort our people never dared imagine...

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Sss'k'a ta'!

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: It is such a pity to die for an outmoded value.  Mr. Quint, I believe it's time for our friend's swimming lesson.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: It's important to learn new skills. Essential to your growth as a person.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: You never seen this before, have you, Billy?  oh, man, you ain't gonna believe it... seawater is like battery acid to these guys... I don't know what it is, some kinds chemical reaction.  Whatta you think it is, Watson?  Whoa, hold him.  What I love about the surf is you can never tell how far up it's going to come until it... whoops, got a little wet there.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Last call, sucker.  One... two... THREE!

Speaker: kipling
Dialogue: When we picked him up, he was talking to those two cops -- the two who came to question you about Hubley.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: This is getting out of hand.  I want you to deal with it.  Immediately.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: We must learn to embrace the things we fear... and from that grow strong.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Would you mind?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: So, she keeps you on a pretty short leash, does she?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: My wife?  She worries about me.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Yeah... I know the routine.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: You are married?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Was.  Divorced.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: We mate for life.  Divorce... is a strange concept to us.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: It's like having an eleventh finger removed.  It hurts like hell, but you never really needed the damn thing in the first place.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Your home is quite disordered.  I thought perhaps you had been burglarized when I walked in.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: I appreciate your honesty, George.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Ignore the bitch on the left, that's Edie.  I call her Edi Amin... This is Kristin, my daughter.  It's kinda an old picture... she's twenty now. Getting married, in fact... on Sunday.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Human children can be very beautiful.  Getting married?  Congratulations. You will be taking Sunday off, then...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: She doesn't need her burn-out of a father there...

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: And this is Richard.  My son.  He's four years old.  We named him after the former President, Richard Nixon.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: You open to a piece of advice?  Tell people you named him after Richard Burton, the actor.  Just take my word for it.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: ... and so, and so the doctor says, "If this is the thermometer, then where'd I leave the pen?"  You're not... you don't think that's funny?  George, work with me, I always get a laugh with that one. Look, if the doctor's got the thermometer in his hand, then where's his pen gotta be?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: In the other man's rectum.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Nada, huh?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Your health...

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Ta ss'trakyona'...

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: There is so much our two peoples don't understand about each other.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: No shit, Holmes.  You're only from another goddamn planet, for chrissakes.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: You humans are very curious to us. You invite us to live among you, in an atmosphere of equality we've never known before.  You lay before us a beautiful green world, full of freedoms and opportunities... You give us ownership of our lives for the first time... and you ask no more of us than you do of yourselves: to live by the rules... rules that aren't made to keep one people subordinate to another, but rules that exist to preserve equality.  You aspire to very high ideals here.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: I hope you can understand how special your world is... how unique a people you humans are.  So it us all the more painful and confusing to us that so few of you seem capable of living up the the ideals you set for yourselves.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Don't count on me, George.  I never had any ideals.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: We don't understand the hatred, the contempt.  But we must bear it... we must not react in anger... because our situation here is still fragile. The separationists would see us returned to the quarantine camps. The fundamentalists say we have no more human rights than dogs or cats. But the prejudice we face here is so insignificant compared to the pain that we've known before.  And that is why we are so grateful.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Yeah, well... except I did hear you eat your dead.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Only on Fridays.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: You son-of-a-bitch.  You're okay.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: I'm going home.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Yeah, go home.  Get some sleep.  You do sleep, don't you?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: What a wildman...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: This better be good news or money.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Hold this.  I feel very terrible.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Where'd you get this?!!

Speaker: jetson

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: She's going to divorce me.

Dialogue: George, she's not gonna divorce you. You mate for life, remember?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: She's very progressive.  I'm certain she's considering it.

Dialogue: Yeah.

Dialogue: They're still there if you wanna catch them.

Dialogue: Well, let's roll, George.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: To the... to the beach?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Come on, let's go, dude.  Surf's up!

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: All right, okay.  Keep your pantyhose on.  Jeez, when in doubt, freak out, for chrissake.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: It's all right, George.  It's cool. Just wait here, all right?  I'll be back in a coupla minutes.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: fedorchuk
Dialogue: Found his wallet in his jacket pocket.  Joshua Strader, big as life.

Dialogue: Jesus, what a mess.  It's gonna be a bear to make a positive determination, but it looks to me like he was shot before being tossed in the drink.  At least twice--  -- here, and here.

Dialogue: How're you two doing on Tuggle's killer?

Dialogue: Yeah, that's real good.  You guys follow up on that for a coupla months.

Dialogue: Look at your dildo partner.  He's too scared to even come down to the sand.  You're not gonna get wet standing here, moron!

Dialogue: I'd like to see you next to a sea of hydrochloric acid, Fedorchuk... see how much surfin' you'd do.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Cute.

Dialogue: Well, if it isn't Detective Jetson. Forget you hip waders, big guy?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Lay off, asshole.

Dialogue: I may be an asshole, but at least I'm a real detective, not some outer shit space thing.

Dialogue: Yeah?  you're a real honest-to-god detective...?

Dialogue: Then detect these!

Dialogue: Nothing.

Dialogue: ... So we've got three guys dead. All Newcomers, all killed the same way -- execution style.

Dialogue: Warren Hubley was in middle management at a refinery... Joshua Strader operated a successful bar and nightclub...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: You guys finished the postmortem on Strader yet?

Dialogue: You mean the Blob?  They're finishing up now.

Dialogue: Is Bentner here?  I must speak with him.

Dialogue: He went home early -- his kid was sick.

Dialogue: Yeah, but he left something for you.

Speaker: winter
Dialogue: Does this have something to do with the test he ran that he wouldn't tell me about?

Dialogue: What kind of test?

Speaker: winter

Dialogue: Did he find anything?

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Well?

Dialogue: What's this nothing shit?  It wasn't nothing yesterday when you asked Bentner to run that test and he looked like he was about to shit peach pits, and it's not nothing now.  Don't lie to me, George, you're bad at it.

Dialogue: You must leave me alone on this.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: No secrets, goddammit!  You don't hold back from me.  Whatever is going on, you're gonna tell me now!

Dialogue: No.  I cannot involve you.  This is not your concern.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: The hell it isn't, when somebody wires up enough C-4 explosive to my car to turn me into pink mist!  TELL ME!  What is it?

Dialogue: ... It is called ss'jabroka'.  To us it is a potent narcotic.

Dialogue: How potent?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Like your cocaine, I suppose.  The "high" lasts several hours.  We would receive small amounts of it... as a reward for our labor.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: We?  You've taken it?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: We all did.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Where did he get it?  Was there any of it on the ship?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: No... I am sure not.  That is why I am so concerned... someone must now be producing it here.  But none of my people know how to make it.  The process was carefully guarded.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Why didn't you tell me sooner? Why'd you hold out on me?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Your people don't know about this part of out past.  And they can't know -- It would threaten our entire existence here.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: George... look me in the eye... George, you don't ever lie to me again.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: I must trust you, Matthew.  I cannot stop this without you.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: George?  How about you drive...

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: There's gotta be some other connection.

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: Here's Hubley.  Left Quarantine on November thirtieth, relocated first to Riverside, then moved to Los Angeles early in February the following year.  Field of expertise: chemical manufacturing.  Looks like he passed up several other better paying jobs waiting for that one at the refinery.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Try Joshua Strader, will ya, darlin'?

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: For you, anything.

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: Released on November twenty-ninth. Came immediately to L.A.  Ten weeks after arriving he took over the abandoned club which is now Encounters.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Now the store owner, please.  Cecil Porter.

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: Released December one.  He and his wife moved first to Modesto, then Coalinga, California -- wherever that is -- settled in L.A. in April.  Field of expertise: organic chemical engineering.  He and his wife have one child, a son.

Dialogue: Yeah -- we met him.  Wonderful boy... close personal friend of George's here.

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Matt.  Nothing here seems to be matching up...

Dialogue: Holy shit...  You and the store owner's son -- that punker!

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: ... Quarantine.

Dialogue: Can you dig up their Quarantine records in this thing?

Dialogue: Sure.  Just a minute.

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: Porter was in Lodge seven seven two.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: Quite lovely...  What is your name again?

Speaker: cassandra
Dialogue: Cassandra.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: I will have to remember that...

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: They had months in quarantine to develop the plan.  Porter, with his chemistry background, must have somehow come up with the formula for the drug.  Hubley manufactured it -- at the refinery.  Strader, through the nightclub, established a distribution network.  And Harcourt--

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Harcourt was the brain who brought it all together.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: Okay, George -- we gotta play this real smart.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: If the drug is here, we must destroy it.

Dialogue: No, George -- you're missing the point.  The drug is evidence.  We need to have the evidence, ya know?

Dialogue: That's the guy...

Dialogue: So much for playing it smart...

Dialogue: Is that it...?

Dialogue: Uh, George...

Dialogue: Where is the drug?  Where have they taken it?

Dialogue: WHERE?!

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: George, uh... you're gonna break his little chest bones...

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Stay out of this, Matthew.  Tell me where the drug has been taken or I will crush your lungs against this wall.

Dialogue: Don't piss him off, O'Neal.  When he gets like this, I can't control him. I've seen this before.  He got like this once -- I saw him jerk a guy's spine out and show it to him. Nothing I could do.  I hadda go throw up.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: How much?

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: Where have they taken it?

Dialogue: George, c'mon -- lighten up.  It's a beauty of a case.  Don't sweat it -- we got him by the short hairs. He ain't gonna make any more of the shit.

Speaker: jetson
Dialogue: The fifty kilos, Matthew.  I have to find it.  I can't let it get out on the street.

Dialogue: Why?  What's the big goddamn deal?

Dialogue: Hey!!

Dialogue: GEORGE!  GODDAMMIT!!

Dialogue: Police.  Get out.  I need this thing.  Out, now!

Dialogue: In there.

Dialogue: Show me.

Dialogue: It's been a long time, hasn't it, gentlemen?

Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: A sweet indulgence from out past... resurrected for our future.

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: Please feel free to sample the quality.  The experience will be everything you remember it to be...

Dialogue: Where'd you get it?

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: I arranged to spend some time with three very resourceful men.  With a certain amount of coaxing, one of them was able to reconstitute the formula for me.  They worked very well together. Unfortunately, they are no longer with us... but I was fortunate enough to reap the benefit of their endeavor.

Dialogue: Let me try some.  Jesus!  Tastes like detergent!

Speaker: harcourt
Dialogue: And that's all the effect it will have on you.  But when my fellow Newcomers learn they can obtain it here, they will work very hard... to make as much money as they can... to give it to me.

Dialogue: You haven't told him all of it.

Dialogue: He's got the C-4 charge!

Dialogue: Just take it real casual, buddy. Keep your finger on that button and don't do nothing squirrely.

Dialogue: If you release that button, you not only kill us, but yourself.

Dialogue: To get you and that--  -- I would do it.

Dialogue: Everyone up against that wall. Very slowly.  Except you.

Dialogue: One small matter seems to have escaped your attention.  That--  -- is not on any books as a controlled substance.  Legally it might as well be fifty kilos of... grape jelly.

Dialogue: Green light, Matthew.  Green light!

Dialogue: No, Sergeant -- not history...  Eternity...

Dialogue: ... Still, I gotta tell you, George, for a quiet guy, you're sure hell on wheels once you get going.  I'd kinda hate to miss your next two days as a detective.

Dialogue: And it's shooting.  Singular.

Dialogue: They said two.

Dialogue: Nope.  I didn't shoot Harcourt... he o.d.'d.

Dialogue: So it's just me and her left in the hot tub, right?

Dialogue: You and the blonde?

Dialogue: No, man, the redhead.  The blonde's gone in the house with some other guy.  But a few minutes later she comes back out, alone, when me and the redhead are going at it fast and furious in the tub, ya know... and she sees us, and... she climbs right in with us...

Dialogue: We can't let him get away.
